experience_assessment: I have published one or two papers in this area.
title: Official Blind Review #2
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I carefully checked the derivations and theory.
review:
The authors propose a differentially private estimator for survival functions, their confidence intervals and test statistics. An Extension for the competing risk cumulative incidence function is also presented. Experiments on nine datasets are presented.

The algorithm is simple, readily extends to KM's confidence interval, the logrank test statistic and the competing risk cumulative function. Theoretical results follow from the count nature of the data (number of events and risk set size).

From the experiments it is noticeable that the the differentially private estimator consistently overestimates risk (see Figure 1 nad Table 2, left) and the logrank test statistic (table 2, right). This is not addressed in the paper.

The work, although interesting, is of very limited value to the ICLR community.
